programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: Investigating if the weather was entirely to blame when two crew members and 16 oil rig staff were killed when a helicopter flying from Aberdeen to a North Sea rig hit a storm.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A threatening customer puts the store on a high alert, while Ashley and Seth bet on whether a stripper's pole will sell.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds clash over whether they should be armed after Les's confrontation with a customer, and Ashley fails to close a deal.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: One of the teams puts the hunt on hold to protect local children from an alligator terrorising their neighbourhood, while another group adopts a secret new strategy.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Art gets some unexpected help from Joey Barnes, 'The King of the Obsolete' on a trip north, while Todd and Lisa encounter a road block as they race to keep Polar in the load count competition. Elsewhere, Darrell continues to teach Reno the tricks of navigating the ice road, but his overprotective ways threaten to drive his pupil to distraction.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.sub-title: Journey to the End of the Earth
programme.desc: Art, Lisa and Todd head to Fort Severn, Ontario, carrying building materials and equipment, but slick corners and a rapidly melting river crossing threaten to bring the journey to an early end. While making his first solo run, Reno foolishly ignores Darrell's advice to slow down and his speed causes his load to shift on the trailer, leaving it at risk of overbalancing. Meanwhile, VP Express completes as many short-haul deliveries as possible as the season nears its end.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike finds a rare retro motor in a West Virginia museum, and takes a fancy to an electronic peacock.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les tells a frightening story of a hold-up at his grandfather's store, and a dominatrix brings her gear into the shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Staff at the Detroit family pawn shop encounter a gynaecologist's table and an elephant's skull.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Theorists explore world mythology as they investigate whether extraterrestrials could be responsible for mankind's existence, having visited from other planets with Earth-like characteristics.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: An examination of what ufology calls 'trace cases', where physical material from a strange encounter is analysed to determine if it is evidence of an alien contact.

programme.title: Ancient Top Ten
programme.desc: Behind every great empire - from Rome to Alexandria - there is a central metropolis. This programme considers of all those recorded, which could be thought the most renowned.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value a battered Evel Knievel pinball machine, a collection of antique glass eyes, and a signed photograph of baseball player Babe Ruth.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team ponders whether to buy a watch formerly owned by convicted fraudster Bernie Madoff, and also considers a 1950s bowling game.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A cheerleader visits the shop to pawn her ring from the 1989 Super Bowl, and there is a chance to buy a motor home.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers consider buying a straitjacket that belonged to Harry Houdini, a letter from activist Helen Keller and a loudspeaker from the Brooklyn Dodgers' stadium.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Things get physical between Dan and Dave when the desert heat sets tempers on edge, while Ivy plays it cool bidding on a high-risk locker.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy and Mary enter into an unusual alliance when the gang hits Koreatown, and Brandi steps into a classic 1980s movie when Jarrod finds a Tron costume.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: When Allen and Ton buy a unit full of old whiskey, a night of partying leads to tough sales. Plus, the guys find a set of RC race boats.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen is reminded of his time as a theme park boat captain when he uncovers vintage animatronics, and the guys find a wrestling ring.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les challenges Seth to a high-stakes sales competition, but later faces the most dangerous customer he has ever encountered.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Hordes of angry customers face hour-long queues, Les tries to work out whether a dealer is selling stolen goods, and a feud erupts between Seth and Andy.

programme.title: Ancient Top Ten
programme.desc: From mysterious Stonehenge to the jaw-dropping temple of Karnak, the greatest monuments of the ancient world show wealth and power, and suggest an adversary not to be messed with. This programme reveals the top 10 archaeological sites crowned the most impressivec monuments of the ancient world.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: The bloodless murder of livestock has plagued farmlands worldwide for generations. This programme considers the possible involvement of extraterrestrial beings in the act.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate whether alien life forms are thriving in Earth's seas, following Russian cosmonauts' discovery of living plankton in space.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A team of experts looks into the Orion constellation to investigate whether this could have been an entry point for aliens visiting Earth.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: Paul sets out in his own boat after having been fired by Dave, roping in his fishing legend brother to help him plan his revenge on his former employer.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Allen head to Mission Hills for a two-unit auction where they go for an electric car, a home brewing system and high-end rifles.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys bag themselves a custom drift car and a luxury antiques unit which may contain a First World War pilot pistol. Plus, Ton gets into trouble at a car sale.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths must forge a fully functional serrated knife using steel from hand scissors, or risk getting cut from the competition.

programme.title: Forged: Man At Arms
programme.sub-title: Man at Arms: Art of War
programme.desc: The crew recreates the Incan macana and the conquistador breastplate - two crucial components in the epic struggle between two American civilisations.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod argue over the value of a bizarre horse's head. Barry bids for a locker full of antique furniture, and Dave makes his strangest discovery ever.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers look for 1970s memorabilia in California, where Barry finds a relic from his past and Darrell discovers a lucrative medical device.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: When Allen and Ton buy a unit full of old whiskey, a night of partying leads to tough sales. Plus, the guys find a set of RC race boats.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen is reminded of his time as a theme park boat captain when he uncovers vintage animatronics, and the guys find a wrestling ring.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts an extended edition of the satirical current affairs quiz from December 2016, with Citizen Khan star Adil Ray and Conservative MP Jacob Rees-Mogg joining captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Australian TV presenter and comedienne Julia Zemiro makes her debut on the obscure general knowledge quiz, joining Sue Perkins, Ross Noble and regular panellist Alan Davies to answer Stephen Fry's fiendish questions on the theme of jeopardy.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: The comedian performs a series of witty stand-up shows, beginning with jokes about the messages people receive every day.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: The comedian consults his beloved laptop computer as he examines celebrity culture and star lookalikes.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Secrets of the Solar System
programme.desc: A grand tour of the solar system, unravelling secrets that the planets have harboured for millions of years, and discovering that Earth almost never existed at all.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson takes a four-day trek along the coastline between Plymouth in Devon and Falmouth, learning about the thriving smuggling trade in Cornwall during the late 18th century. The area's tiny secretive harbours, beaches and secluded coves were ideal for illicit imports such as tobacco and brandy, and the business was so huge it threatened the national economy. Along his route, visiting such beauty spots as Lantic Bay and Polperro, he encounters all sorts of reminders of the trade and meets descendants of those involved.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. He begins with a towpath exploration of industrial engineering along the Leeds and Liverpool Canal. Setting off from Liverpool, he takes a three-day walk inland to Wigan, ending at the town's iconic pier as he traces the story of the waterway's chaotic construction and its impact on the development of Lancashire.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson explores the history of the ancient kingdom on a walk from Melrose in the Scottish Borders to Holy Island off the coast of Northumberland. Over five days, he goes on the trail of one of Northumbria's greatest sons - Saint Cuthbert. Through the Tweed Valley and across the Cheviot Hills, it's a journey through a murky history laden with myth. However, by investigating the communities, power bases and landscape of seventh-century Northumbria, Tony aims to understand the pagan land in which Cuthbert spread his simple brand of Celtic Christianity.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson travels along the north Norfolk coast through one of the least developed spots in Britain, finding out how the area maintained its rural, remote identity despite the dynamic industrial changes of the Victorian age. From the arrival of Bertie, Prince of Wales at Sandringham House to the opening of Cromer Pier, Tony's four-day walk sees him learn about key periods in the county's history. He explores prime shooting estates, purpose-built seaside resorts, salt marshes and disused railway lines as he discovers how powerful landowners were able to control development and even shape the railways to suit their needs.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston tells the story of Hitler's state executioner, who was placed in charge of killing thousands of people declared enemies of the state.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The pursuit of former Austrian policeman Franz Stangl, who served as commandant of the Nazi extermination camps Sobibor and Treblinka.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: The Tablelands Railways Line - Jungle Secrets
programme.desc: The Tablelands Railway Line in Queensland, Australia, which changed the face of one of the country's great states when it was constructed in the late 1800s.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Unusual rail networks designed to traverse water, including the Indian Ocean, the earthquake zones of the Bosphorus Strait and the sea cliffs of the Italian Riviera.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An advanced German battleship that sank in a Norwegian fjord during the Second World War, the Miles Glacier Bridge in Alaska, and a mysterious concrete giant in Bulgaria.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team return to examine more items brought in by viewers, beginning with a visit to Plas Newydd Country House and Gardens on Anglesey. Collectibles assessed include a Victorian cane carved with an image of the Menai suspension bridge, an 18th century grandmother clock, and two giant toy giraffes.

programme.title: Mountain: Life at the Extreme
programme.desc: This episode looks at life on the highest mountain range on Earth, the Himalayas, home to many extraordinary animals and remarkable ancient cultures. The programme follows snow leopards as they creep into isolated mountain villages searching for food, and monkeys huddling for warmth in a hidden, frozen forest, and the athletes who compete in the gruelling Everest marathon.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an insight into the most successful animals on the planet. Observing an Arctic fox stalk prey in its -20C environment, he reveals warm-bloodedness as one of the key factors in the mammals' global domination. He also studies marsupials in Australia and Central America, offering a unique view inside a platypus's breeding burrow.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The drive to make trains faster, from supersonic rocket sleds to engines that seem to fly above their guideways.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of German architect Albert Speer, one of the only war criminals to accept his guilt during the Nuremberg trials, although there were doubts about the scale of his remorse.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A highway built in the Brazilian jungle as an escape route in the event of an emergency at a nuclear power station, a Soviet fortress and Ellis Island hospital.

programme.title: dinnerladies diaries
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of the sitcom, featuring interviews with the cast as they reminisce about the show on its 20th anniversary.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: It is work experience day, but Bren cannot show the new girl a typical routine in the canteen because the new boy has blocked the front of the cooker with his ladder - which the bread delivery woman refuses to go under. Canteen comedy, with Victoria Wood, Thelma Barlow, Sue Cleaver and Shobna Gulati.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Jean vents her anger on the customers, while Tony considers asking Bren to accompany him on a trip to Marbella. Petula returns with interesting news, and Anita celebrates the second week of her relationship with Pedro. Victoria Wood stars.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Bren is so excited about her forthcoming holiday with Tony she even considers buying some new clothes, and while a forlorn Stan tells everyone his sad news, Petula gets a little hot under the collar in her caravan. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood and Julie Walters.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright tries to make Nurse Gladys Emmanuel jealous and decides to advertises for a live-in housekeeper, but is taken aback when Mrs Featherstone applies for the position.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville decides a fashion makeover is needed to impress Stephanie from the local boutique, but Arkwright's meddling soon puts paid to any romantic dalliance. Roy Clarke's classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Nurse Gladys decides Arkwright needs a lesson in politeness, and convinces him a writer for the Good Shop Guide is doing the rounds. She then poses as the critic to see for herself the unusual sight of the miserly shopkeeper being nice to his customers. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Lynda Baron.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: The discovery of a man's body in a disused mine shaft reawakens villagers' suspicions over a girl's death - and the mismatched duo's investigation lifts the lid on murder, mystery and intrigue. Feature-length drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan as the chalk-and-cheese detectives, with Polly Hemingway and Joe Duttine.

credits.actor: Colin Buchanan as the chalk-and-cheese detectives

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part crime drama. Connor and Walker fear for the children's safety as their suspicions about Harwood are confirmed, and when they finally catch up with him it seems he has lost his mind. David Hayman, Victoria Smurfit and Charles Dance star.

programme.title: Don't Ask Me Ask Britain
programme.desc: Interactive comedy game show hosted by Alexander Armstrong, which uses an app to poll the viewing public on moral dilemmas big and small, while two celebrity teams go head to head to try and second guess the views of the nation.

programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The latest on the coronavirus pandemic with Lorraine Kelly, including medical advice and stories of how people are coping with the lockdown.

programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which teams of five compete to answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Five account managers from Harrogate, North Yorkshire attempt to win the cash.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Mark, Sam, Ian and Diane pit their wits against a ruthless quiz genius in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Charity seeks out Priya for help, Harriet and Malone play with fire, and Moira and Cain talk about the divorce.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Steve and Leanne await the outcome of Oliver's tests, the Baileys display differing attitudes to racial abuse and Gemma realises that she is not alone.

programme.title: Coronavirus: Q&A
programme.desc: Nina Hossein puts viewers' questions on a range of subjects relating to the Covid-19 outbreak to a panel of expert guests.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Kent couple Lou and Andy Webb have two young children affected by a rare genetic condition that severely restricts their eyesight, meaning they only see in black and white and have to wear special goggles in sunlight. Alan Titchmarsh's challenge is to create a more child-friendly garden for their terraced home in Tonbridge, and his first task is to make a shady environment so the kids can spend time outside in the day. After that, he and the team come up with a bespoke lighting system for the evenings, acoustic fencing to cut down the noise from a nearby railway line, and an area for the parents.

programme.title: Harry's Heroes: Euro Having a Laugh
programme.desc: Harry Redknapp takes his team of ex-England players on a European tour, as they prepare for a rematch against theGerman Legends on their own soil. They begin in France at a self-catering hotel in the quiet medieval town of Provins, where Harrywants them to be on a detox and cook their own healthy food, but they don't even get through the first night without hitting the beers and ending up at the curry house.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.desc: Cameroon v England. Gabriel Clarke introduces highlights of the thrilling 1990 World Cup quarter-final from Stadio San Paolo in Naples, Italy. With original coverage hosted by Nick Owen and Elton Welsby and pre-match analysis from Bobby Moore and Jimmy Greaves.

programme.desc: Prepare yourself for a big dose of Girl Power! Check out these chart-topping hits from some of music's biggest female stars.

programme.title: UK HOTLIST Top 20
programme.desc: We count down the UK's most-streamed tracks of the week, as compiled by Spotify.

programme.title: Buzzin' With Big Hits
programme.desc: Nothing but the biggest hits around from the biggest artists on the planet, right here, right now.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Aliens: The Definitive Guide
programme.desc: Part one of two. Scientists investigate the possibility of extra-terrestrial life, beginning with what aliens might look like and how they could sound.

programme.title: What On Earth?
programme.desc: The legends of ancient giants surrounding a mysterious monument in the Holy Land. Plus, how satellite images help with the investigation into a missing boy.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Jr unveils the most important build of his career at Ground Zero in Manhattan, while OCC works on two bikes and a rival challenges both firms to a build-off.

programme.title: Alaska Mega Machines
programme.desc: An insight into how a mega fish factory produced three million pounds of seafood a day. Plus, a flying ambulance operating 14,000 feet above Alaska's wilderness.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe carries out a repair 8,500 feet above the city of Palm Springs when he goes to work on a troubled building site.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew explores the inner workings of an Audi R8 to find out how it is made.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: How a Rolls-Royce Phantom is made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The process of fabricating fire gloves for use by emergency services personnel, and the creation of enamel used in bakeware all over the world.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Bike guru Henry Cole and his friend Sam Lovegrove, the 'Engine Whisperer', take a trip from Cornwall to Oxfordshire to rummage around in some of Britain's most amazing sheds in search of a nice little earner.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove meet Phil in sunny Buckinghamshire, where they find stationary engines, traction engines and vintage petrol cans - but is there anything for the boys to restore and flog?.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: An inexperienced crewman leaves the Seabrooke in shame, and treacherous waters surrounding St Paul island make offloading crab extremely hazardous.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.sub-title: Deadliest Catch: Scariest Moments at Sea
programme.desc: Compelling compilation of life and death on the high seas; showcasing some of the world's most dangerous fisheries including Bering Sea crab fishing and offshore lobster fishing..

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: A training tower for firefighters is pulled apart. Meanwhile in Cheshire, Steve and Luke help a boat on its last journey and in Hampshire a scrap yard is torn down.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China restore a Jaguar XJC, an iconic 'corporate sports car' that is likely to attract plenty of admirers.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini visits a private collection of vintage Cooper F1 race cars and is stunned to see a rare BMW 315 and also a Bugatti. Plus, he considers a Multipla.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini travels by private jet to visit a 1957-themed show at the Mekum auction house.

programme.title: Supercar Superbuild
programme.desc: The design and construction of supercars, beginning with the Aston Martin V12 Vantage S.

programme.title: Disasters at Sea
programme.sub-title: Death on the Staten Island Ferry
programme.desc: An investigation into an event of October 2003, when a ferry between Manhattan and Staten Island crashed into a pier, killing 11 people and injuring many more.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Opilio season draws to a close and two skippers suffer debilitating injuries, while the captain of the Wizard assaults an unlikely victim.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce purchases a Second World War army uniform for 40,000 when hunting for paratrooper gear, while Hus almost throws up when doing loops in a Mustang.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: A hunt for fresh stock takes Drew Pritchard to the Cotswolds, where he finds a giant stash of Indian and Afghan treasures which have come directly from the subcontinent.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Blackpool, an old pub is pulled down, and in Portsmouth the boat breakers break up an unused and unloved yacht. Plus, a house is cleared of its treasures.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads for Turin to buy a Fiat 500, but the only way to get it back to the UK is to drive it, and the engine is in need of urgent attention.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: With partner Dan stuck at home, Justin starts the new mining season alone. He is dealt a huge blow as he discovers their rich underground mine has been pegged by another miner.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to the Malvern Hills, where he unearths one of his most unusual finds. Plus, he visits a famed stone mason's in Liverpool to examine rare artisan carvings.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: A violent summer storm sees the Young Guns race to save their only claim from a flood. Former trucker Chris arrives in Lightning Ridge, desperate to make a fortune in opal.

programme.title: Jade Fever
programme.desc: Claudia and Robin Bunce own a large jade mining chain and tourist shop in remote Jade City, Canada. If they strike it rich, everyone wins - if they fail, whole town suffers..

programme.title: Jade Fever
programme.desc: Claudia, Robin and the crew scramble to get their heavy equipment up a mountain before rising rivers make it impossible to get to the mining claim..

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The safety systems used by racing drivers to help them survive crashes at speeds of up to 300kph, plus the processes involved in the manufacture of impregnable bank vaults.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Including the best way to stop a speeding car, and the secrets of a spectacular display that involves 75,000 litres of water being shot to an amazing height.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: After a nerve-racking test-drive, Mike Brewer buys a 1981 Series III Land Rover without an MOT for Edd China to restore.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Two of America's leading coroners explain how pivotal their job can be in a murder investigation.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Beth von Steinner. Days after she was reported missing, her frozen body was found behind her house. With no witnesses or suspects, only CCTV footage could reveal the exact fate that had behallen her.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of 50-year-old George Jodoin, a New Hampshire man known throughout his community in the small town of Auburn. Arthur Collins, friend of the victim, was convicted in June 2015, 14 years after Jodoin was shot several times in the head.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A case in which three prisoners escaped from their prison transport on their way to court, leaving a trail of chaos including an armed carjacking in their wake.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Puppies are found abandoned in a ditch, and their chances of being rehomed are jeopardised by their health problems.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Peter needs to remove a grass seed from a dog's eye. Dr Alex tries to fix a traumatised puppy that has been attacked and a massive dog comes in for a check-up.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: You're Sexy and You Know It
programme.desc: Belly-dancing paralegal Sahar has her fitting, while Aimee goes in search of a tight dress with plenty of bling.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: The Big Day
programme.desc: Sheena realises her mother has hijacked her dream Indian wedding, leading to clashes over how to spend her unlimited budget.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown has an all-night marathon in a canine maternity ward, and a rabbit is hit with a bad case of heatstroke.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown is desperate to save the life of a frail three-day old foal that has just been orphaned. Plus, Dr Lisa Chimes is trying to help a greedy cat that ate a 50cm ribbon.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigator Jennifer Francis seizes four emaciated horses and a calf following a heated exchange with their owner.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The SPCA responds to a call about two dogs that have been callously abandoned by their owner. Investigator Kirstie Franks goes to the rescue.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Firefighters discover an unidentified charred body when they are called to the scene of a house fire in the middle of the night.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 19-year-old Connecticut man Angel Garcia who went missing in October 2011 after riding his dirt bike. Friends claimed he was chased by an sport utility vehicle before he vanished. Several months later, a possible sighting raised hopes.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Macin Smith. When the 17-year-old failed to return from school, his parents feared for his safety and a note hidden in his wallet increased their torment.

programme.title: The Perfect Murder
programme.desc: The crimes of lawyer Carlos Perez-Olivo, who in 2006 shot his wife in the head the same day he sent flowers to his long-time mistress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Jessica breaks tradition and brings her fiance to help her find a gown, while Jamie lacks a clear vision of how she wants to look on her wedding day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Julie-Ann and her husband arrive at the salon to select a dress for their vow renewal, while Carol asks her daughter for input on a gown for her second wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: American Chopper star Paul Teutul Jr accompanies his fiancee Rachael to Kleinfeld's as they look for the right dress for their red carpet wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride Kristy wants to look like a pirate at her wedding, while Laura's father does not shy away from voicing his ideas on the perfect dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Sarah vows to turn Virgina's appointment around when they realise the dress of her dreams has been sold. Meanwhile, Kelly's dress must be taken apart seam by seam.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Syndal marries into New York Yankee royalty and her friends come with notepads to help rate each dress. Plus, bride-to-be Danielle returns for her first fitting.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three collectors spend a day at Porte de Vanves flea market in Paris with expert Mark Franks, before upcycling their items and selling their wares in Clapham, south London.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, pawnbroker Dan is visited by renowned snooker player and commentator Willie Thorne who wants to do a deal on an original artwork, and a world champion Thai boxer hopes to pawn three of his championship belts. At Pickwick Pawnbrokers in south-east London, Nathan and assistant Deb test-drive an ice-cream van that owner Sam wishes to sell, and Tom has a diamond ring he wants to dispose of.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Devoted girlfriend and loving aunt Alicia is all smiles on the outside, though inside is terrified her addiction to food will kill her before she can marry.

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.desc: Kody plans to legally marry Robyn following his divorce from Meri - but things are not as simple as he hopes.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at a wedding dress shop catering to larger customers.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at a wedding dress shop catering to larger customers.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: A mother and her two young children mysteriously go missing. Then, two local boys nearby also disappear. Is there a serial predator on the loose in rural Missouri?.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators who use minute scraps of evidence to discover the full story behind a murder and solve serious crimes.
